commit_message:
objects: convert config drive to use ImageMeta object

The config drive code checks for a property 'img_config_drive'
in the instance system metadata. Add this property to the
ImageMetaProps object and convert the config drive code to
use the ImageMeta object for accessing it.

Change-Id: Id96af7e6f8429c58a8224c3d32c982a3af7d9cd7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/23/189323/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova import objects from nova.objects import fields image_meta = objects.ImageMeta.from_instance(instance) image_prop = image_meta.properties.get( "img_config_drive", fields.ConfigDrivePolicy.OPTIONAL) image_prop == fields.ConfigDrivePolicy.MANDATORY
deleted_lines: image_prop = utils.instance_sys_meta(instance).get( utils.SM_IMAGE_PROP_PREFIX + 'img_config_drive', 'optional') if image_prop not in ['optional', 'mandatory']: LOG.warning(_LW('Image config drive option %(image_prop)s is invalid ' 'and will be ignored'), {'image_prop': image_prop}, instance=instance) image_prop == 'mandatory'

commit_message:
Support for keepalived role

Keepalived could be used to maintain a virtual IP address per VRRP protocol,
monitor a process as specified, and perform fail-over when it detects a failure
in the monitored process.

The role includes a default vrrp_script for monitoring haproxy and the provided
keepalived-install.yml playbook installs the keepalived to haproxy_hosts.
However, a variable named "keepalived_instances" needs be defined with
deployment details for keepalived otherwise the keepalived daemon will be
running but not maintaining any VRRP virtual IP address or monitoring haproxy
process.

The vrrp_script could be customized or extended to support monitoring
additional services other than haproxy.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: 1414397
Change-Id: I132ef7bce99d6f6a0d0ca291bcf761e6d35a2fad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/17/217517/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind=1

commit_message:
Fix property inheritance for node templates

Fix issues with property inheritance that cause a derived node
not inherit all its parent(s) property definitions. Add proper
unit tests as well.

Change-Id: Ia27af7e3fef742ccf71beecfc47e56483e9ebc37
Closes-Bug: #1483896
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tosca-parser refs/changes/50/219850/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_proprety_inheritance(self): from toscaparser.nodetemplate import NodeTemplate tosca_custom_def = ''' tosca.nodes.SoftwareComponent.MySoftware: derived_from: SoftwareComponent properties: install_path: required: false type: string default: /opt/mysoftware ''' tosca_node_template = ''' node_templates: mysoftware_instance: type: tosca.nodes.SoftwareComponent.MySoftware properties: component_version: 3.1 ''' expected_properties = ['component_version', 'install_path'] nodetemplates = yamlparser.\ simple_parse(tosca_node_template)['node_templates'] custom_def = yamlparser.simple_parse(tosca_custom_def) name = list(nodetemplates.keys())[0] tpl = NodeTemplate(name, nodetemplates, custom_def) self.assertIsNone(tpl.validate()) self.assertEqual(expected_properties, sorted(tpl.get_properties().keys()))

commit_message:
Bump upper-constraints on keystonemiddleware to 2.2.0

The latest version of keystonemiddleware is 2.2.0 as of 9/3 and it
appears there is an AttributeError in some of the auth token validation
code in 2.1.0, so we should raise the cap so we can get the latest
version which hopefully has that bug fixed.

Related-Bug: #1492508

Change-Id: I0bcf0b505a5196ae4d64b79fbee7f966ebc1f234
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/08/220708/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
WIP Modify resource_id of AWS LoadBalancer

Expose id of the underlying instance running HAProxy as resource id of
AWS::ElasticLoadBalancing::LoadBalancer resource.

That will allow assignment of floating IP in the same template that
creates LoadBalancer itself.

Change-Id: I96b406d831acaf5ff691af9afd2454a848b0bbd2

commit_message:
Generalizes $collection.attribute to $iterable.attribute


Previously such operation was defined for sequences only (implementations
of collection.Sequence with exception of strings and dicts - 
currently it is only list (tuple) - fixed-size indexable collections). 
Now it is defined for iterables (i.e. things you can iterate over 
other than strings and dicts = sequences + generators)


Change-Id: I3fa36728517d9c4a201b2d38805da0ecdaf6cf0b

Update Bootswatch to 3.3.5-3

Bootswatch needed an update to not default google font imports from
google.com  It can now be customized using a variable.

still very much in progress.. started on changing instance_manager and
the nova wrapper to support driver abstracted things like id's and such

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2015 AKANDA, INC. All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from akanda.rug.drivers.base import BaseDriver from akanda.rug.api import configuration class Router(BaseDriver): RESOURCE_NAME = 'Router' @staticmethod def update_status(worker_context, logical_obj, status): """Updates status of logical resource :param worker_context: worker_context object :param logical_obj: logical object :param status: :return: None """ worker_context.neutron.update_router_status(logical_obj.id, status) @staticmethod def get_logical_config(worker_context, logical_id): """static method gets logical config of the logical resource passed in :param worker_context: worker_context object :param logical_id: id of logical resource :return: returns the logical config from neutron """ return worker_context.neutron.get_router_detail(logical_id) @staticmethod def build_config(worker_context, logical_obj, instance_info, if_map): """Builds / rebuilds config :param worker_context: :param logical_obj: :param instance_info: :param if_map: :return: config object """ return configuration.build_config( worker_context.neutron, logical_obj, instance_info.management_port, if_map ) def preplug(self): """preplug the external port :param worker_context: :param logical_obj: :return: None """ if self.external_port is None: # FIXME: Need to do some work to pick the right external # network for a tenant. self.log.debug('Adding external port to router') self.external_port = \ self.worker_context.neutron.create_router_external_port( self ) def preboot(self): """calls self.preplug() in this driver :return: self.preplug() """ return self.preplug()

commit_message:
Magic Search in Angular Users table

Identity API V3 supports user API filter, V2 does not.

To test:
(1) Set DISABLED to False in _3031_identity_users_panel.py
(2) Enable V3 in local_settings.py (OPENSTACK_API_VERSIONS = {"identity": 3,})

Co-Authored-By: Randy Bertram <rbertram@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: Aaron Sahlin <asahlin@us.ibm.com>

Partially Implements: blueprint filtered-client-side-table

Change-Id: I760a5361517785642fbee26be0f3e317ef5361b8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/91/221391/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Set minimum version for passlib

Commit a7235fc0511c643a8441efd3d21fc334535066e2 uses
passlib.utils.MAX_PASSWORD_SIZE, which was only introduced to
passlib in version 1.6

Change-Id: Ic51ac008ee4733c2d642c580f9092b40edad142d

added_lines: date: 2015-09-08 id: OSSA-2015-018 title: 'Neutron firewall rules bypass through port update' description: 'Kevin Benton from Mirantis reported a vulnerability in Neutron. By changing the device owner of an instance''s port right after it is created, an authenticated user may prevent application of firewall rules and so avoid IP anti-spoofing controls. All Neutron setups using the ML2 plugin or a plugin that relies on the security groups AMQP API are affected.' affected-products: - product: neutron version: versions through 2014.2.3 and 2015.1 versions through 2015.1.1 vulnerabilities: - cve-id: CVE-2015-5240 reporters: - name: 'Kevin Benton' affiliation: Mirantis reported: - CVE-2015-5240 issues: links: - https://launchpad.net/bugs/1489111 type: launchpad reviews: liberty: - https://review.openstack.org/221342 kilo: - https://review.openstack.org/221344 juno: - https://review.openstack.org/221345 type: gerrit notes: - 'This fix will be included in future 2014.2.4 (juno) and 2015.1.2 (kilo) releases.'

commit_message:
devstack: Update for keystone v3 auth

This updates the devstack plugin to be able to use CLI client auth params
that are appropriate for the current keystone auth version.  This'll
let our plugin continue to function with v3 auth, which is now the default
in devstack.

This does not update the rug itself to be v3 compat, we'll need to address
that in another patch.

Change-Id: Ie8560c91c4666ed332258d9a917cb03b05ea9fae
Closes-bug: #1475781

commit_message:
Router Interface delete fails to remove interface from snat ns

DVR routers with external gateway set has internal csnat
ports that are mapped to the SNAT namespace.
For every corresponding router interface there will be a
csnat interface configured in the SNAT namepsace.
When you delete or remove a router interface the corresponding
csnat interface should be removed from the SNAT namespace by
the agent.

Right now the csnat interface is not removed by the agent.

This was caused by the l3 agent refactor.

This patch fixes the above mentioned problem.

Closes-Bug: #1479130

Change-Id: I563add438a4ebfca625884123ec27b29eb04084d

commit_message:
Fix wrong argument name in _rpc_update_firewall

Passing id (built-in function id) instead of firewall_id to
get_firewall_routers caused DBErrors due to wrong argument type.

This change fixes this typo and adds missing unit tests that can
prevent such error from appearing in the future.

Change-Id: I35f13b1aab5a566c1e2768a4027e61120bf6ba2e
Closes-Bug: #1475244
(cherry picked from commit caf39a47e3aa08f164e609e5f82ac672eafd88f1)

commit_message:
Set correct attributes for category dropdown

Before category dropdown did not auto closed itself after a category was
selected. This was most likely due to mixed use of jquery and
angular-ui. This commit sets correct data-toggle attribute and
data-disabled, that only enables plain bootstrap usage.
Also sets more "aria-labelledby" to point to toggle button, as most
examples suggest.

Reference: https://github.com/angular-ui/bootstrap/issues/2294

Closes-Bug: #1478945
Change-Id: Ic1da66ac911677aeac7e7a7a6747b60d01b6e05e

commit_message:
Add cd, export and enable service command in doc

While installing the API service and Engine, sample configuration file
is needed to generate inside murano/murano using tox. Hence add cd
command.

While installing and running murano with devstack, environment
variable DEVSTACK_DIR is used. Add export command to set environment
varible. Neutron additional service is also required by murano which
do not come by default with devstack. It is mention and add command to
enable it.

Closes-Bug: #1492192
Change-Id: I2313460f8eae870de2722c078f1676245cb605d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/16/221116/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add cd, export and enable service command in doc

While installing the API service and Engine, sample configuration file
is needed to generate inside murano/murano using tox. Hence add cd
command.

While installing and running murano with devstack, environment
variable DEVSTACK_DIR is used. Add export command to set environment
varible. Neutron additional service is also required by murano which
do not come by default with devstack. It is mention and add command to
enable it.

Partial-Bug: #1492192
Change-Id: I84390a6e01a6b3300a6974c5f84b644c77f60825
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/61/220961/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 2. Copy Murano integration scripts to Devstack either by setting environment variable or providing complete path to devstack directory. Below one is using environment variable:: $ export DEVSTACK_DIR=<complete path to devstack directory(clonned)> 4. The Murano, Neutron and Heat services are not enabled by default, so they must be enabled in ``localrc`` before running ``stack.sh``. This example ``localrc`` # Enable Neutron ENABLED_SERVICES+=,q-svc,q-agt,q-dhcp,q-l3,q-meta,neutron

subject: ID references made model not able to load in 2 passes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-05 22:11:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano/commit/c5e680841f9cdfed0597357056b0f0ba411e7696', 'message': "ID references made model not able to load in 2 passes

ObjectStore used to replace object factories with actual objects
only after 2 passes instead of after first pass as it was before then.
Until that happened object could not be obtained from outside
despite it was already created by the 2nd pass so ID reference
resolution that happened on the second pass failed.

With this fix ObjectStore doesn't tries to hide partially-initialized
objects anymore. So if object A references object B by ID
it may get B after B has been loaded but before its .init was called.
That's not a problem because we just loading (relinking) model
and do not depend on anything that could be initialized in B's .init.
However because B is not owned by A and A is not owned by B
it may happen that .init of A will be executed prior to .init of B
so if A's initializer will see object B that wasn't initialized yet.
Generally this is unavoidable because there may be circular
references. So there were 2 options: either to do more that 2
passes and try to to avoid such situations for cases when
there are no circular references or just require classes not
to do anything with objects they don't own from .init.
Because .init is also called from GC and should not have
side effects at all the second options was chosen but
we may reconsider this in the future

Closes-Bug: #1492640

Change-Id: Id38a780f9084323f0806b044262aa3b89eb5da74

Change-Id: Id38a780f9084323f0806b044262aa3b89eb5da74

commit_message:
ID references made model not able to load in 2 passes

ObjectStore used to replace object factories with actual objects
only after 2 passes instead of after first pass as it was before then.
Until that happened object could not be obtained from outside
despite it was already created by the 2nd pass so ID reference
resolution that happened on the second pass failed.

With this fix ObjectStore doesn't tries to hide partially-initialized
objects anymore. So if object A references object B by ID
it may get B after B has been loaded but before its .init was called.
That's not a problem because we just loading (relinking) model
and do not depend on anything that could be initialized in B's .init.
However because B is not owned by A and A is not owned by B
it may happen that .init of A will be executed prior to .init of B
so if A's initializer will see object B that wasn't initialized yet.
Generally this is unavoidable because there may be circular
references. So there were 2 options: either to do more that 2
passes and try to to avoid such situations for cases when
there are no circular references or just require classes not
to do anything with objects they don't own from .init.
Because .init is also called from GC and should not have
side effects at all the second options was chosen but
we may reconsider this in the future

Closes-Bug: #1492640

Change-Id: Id38a780f9084323f0806b044262aa3b89eb5da74
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/57/220757/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: result = result.object

subject: Fixed functional test that validates graceful ovs agent restart
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-04 20:28:44.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_l2_ovs_agent.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/ed3c317ed9182538747f74713154ad94e9d866db', 'message': "Fixed functional test that validates graceful ovs agent restart

The async_ping function returns a callable that returns True when all ping
futures are done. Since those futures are running for 10 secs, there was no
chance that the result of the callable was True.

The test was bailing out without calling bridge reset even a single time,
effectively leaving the feature untested in gate.

Another thing to note is that for some reason the patch fixed oslo rootwrap
errors in the test when executed locally. Since I still don't understand how
it's possible that it fixes the issue for me, I mark the bug as related only,
and will track logstash after it's merged to see whether it applies unknown
magic to gate jobs too.

Change-Id: Iaa977abddf1a0c6af7e964f1a5cd545ffb79585a
Related-Bug: #1490051
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed functional test that validates graceful ovs agent restart

The async_ping function returns a callable that returns True when all ping
futures are done. Since those futures are running for 10 secs, there was no
chance that the result of the callable was True.

The test was bailing out without calling bridge reset even a single time,
effectively leaving the feature untested in gate.

Another thing to note is that for some reason the patch fixed oslo rootwrap
errors in the test when executed locally. Since I still don't understand how
it's possible that it fixes the issue for me, I mark the bug as related only,
and will track logstash after it's merged to see whether it applies unknown
magic to gate jobs too.

Change-Id: Iaa977abddf1a0c6af7e964f1a5cd545ffb79585a
Related-Bug: #1490051
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/56/220656/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add an ability to set up drop_flows_on_start option

The change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/182920/ introduced graceful OVS
restart option. If this option is set to False, it allows to drop only old flows
Added an ability to manage this option

Change-Id: I45a8770798a30d8ceca3b90850f95e29c59372e0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/86/211986/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*drop_flows_on_start*] # (optional) Set to True to drop all flows during agent start for a clean # flow tables resetting # Defaults to true # $drop_flows_on_start = true, 'agent/drop_flows_on_start': value => $drop_flows_on_start;

commit_message:
Adding code to prevent vip port deletion from port api

When a lbaas port is deleted from the port delete command from
neutron it tries to delete the port but since it is being held
for the vip the database update fails and neutron throws a 500
error

This fix checks if the vip is associated to the port and allows
deletion of the port only if there is no vip associated with the
port

Change-Id: If9f123dedfe86225c52b6d26c76a64e3f5bee15c
Closes-Bug: #1430394
(cherry picked from commit dba6eea593f532b7d7f7b3c1bcd4dee950d6fe18)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/39/217439/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.callbacks import events from neutron.callbacks import registry from neutron.callbacks import resources from neutron.common import constants as n_constants 'device_owner': n_constants.DEVICE_OWNER_LOADBALANCER, def prevent_lbaas_port_deletion(self, context, port_id): try: port_db = self._core_plugin._get_port(context, port_id) except n_exc.PortNotFound: return # Check only if the owner is loadbalancer. if port_db['device_owner'] == n_constants.DEVICE_OWNER_LOADBALANCER: filters = {'port_id': [port_id]} if len(self.get_vips(context, filters=filters)) > 0: reason = _('has device owner %s') % port_db['device_owner'] raise n_exc.ServicePortInUse(port_id=port_db['id'], reason=reason) def subscribe(self): registry.subscribe( _prevent_lbaas_port_delete_callback, resources.PORT, events.BEFORE_DELETE) def _prevent_lbaas_port_delete_callback(resource, event, trigger, **kwargs): context = kwargs['context'] port_id = kwargs['port_id'] port_check = kwargs['port_check'] lbaasplugin = manager.NeutronManager.get_service_plugins().get( constants.LOADBALANCER) if lbaasplugin and port_check: lbaasplugin.prevent_lbaas_port_deletion(context, port_id)

commit_message:
Use oslo utils to encode exception messages

oslo.utils supports a method that convers exception messages to
unicode.
Glance previously had the same method but now we can use
oslo implementation in glance code and we don't need to
bother about supporting it in glance.
It also seems that utility function exception_to_str
in glance.common.utils was accidentally deleted but we didn't fix
it for code that use this utility.

Change-Id: Ib46a931da23492cde8c40869b2a1d718a7f0115b

commit_message:
Use strip for nova_region_name

If neutron.conf file contains some value for nova_region_name before Puppet
execution, if will keep whitespaces from the original value.
Later this value can be passed to neutron_network provider, for example,
which won't authorize at Keystone due to a whitespace in nova_region_name.

Change-Id: I9eddcc3fb2e8224bb541abbb6dd1e770ca5ef76c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/41/220541/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: creds['nova_region_name'] = conf['DEFAULT']['nova_region_name'].strip

commit_message:
event-alarm: add event wrapper class

This patch adds a new wrapper class for event to hold sanitized traits
and related functions. The parser and helper functions for events are
moved to this new class.

Also, this patch makes sure that each event will be sanitized only once
when it loaded.

Change-Id: I3b941ff531afea20b2403eb391ef49cf08cd65e7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/aodh refs/changes/80/221080/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _sanitize_trait_value(value, trait_type): if trait_type in (2, 'integer'): return int(value) elif trait_type in (3, 'float'): return float(value) elif trait_type in (4, 'datetime'): return timeutils.normalize_time(timeutils.parse_isotime(value)) else return six.text_type(value) class InvalidEvent(Exception): """Error raised when the received event has not mandatory fields.""" class Event(object): """Wrapped event object to hold converted values for this evaluator.""" TRAIT_FIELD = 0 TRAIT_TYPE = 1 TRAIT_VALUE = 2 def __init__(self, event): self.obj = event self._validate() self.id = event.get('message_id') self._parse_traits() def _validate(self): """Validate received event has mandatory parameters.""" if not self.obj: LOG.error(_LE('Received invalid event (empty or None)')) raise InvalidEvent() if not self.obj.get('event_type'): LOG.error(_LE('Failed to extract event_type from event = %s'), event) raise InvalidEvent() if not self.obj.get('message_id'): LOG.error(_LE('Failed to extract message_id from event = %s'), event) raise InvalidEvent() def _parse_traits(self): self.traits = {} self.project = '' for t in self.obj.get('traits', []): k = t[self.TRAIT_FIELD] v = _sanitize_trait_value(t[self.TRAIT_VALUE], t[self.TRAIT_TYPE]) self.traits[k] = v if k in ('tenant_id', 'project_id'): self.project = v def get_value(self, field): if field.startswith('traits.'): key = field.split('.', 1)[-1] return self.traits.get(key) v = self.obj for f in field.split('.'): if hasattr(v, 'get'): v = v.get(f) else: return None return v for e in events: LOG.debug('Evaluating event: event = %s', e) try: event = Event(e) except InvalidEvent: for id, alarm in six.iteritems( self._get_project_alarms(event.project)): {'a': id, 'e': e}) {'a': alarm.alarm_id, 'e': event.id}) if not fnmatch.fnmatch(event.obj['event_type'], event_pattern): v = event.get_value(condition['field']) {'message': event.id, 'alarm': alarm.alarm_id}) reason_data = {'type': 'event', 'event': event.obj}

commit_message:
Fix keystone shibboleth template to detect ssl usage correctly

In https://review.openstack.org/194474 the variable keystone_ssl_enabled
was changed to keystone_ssl, but the shibboleth.xml template was missed
in the change.

This patch corrects that.

Change-Id: I8248d01f37d35ddc910d06a4295760ea8924971d
Closes-Bug: #1492250
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/80/220480/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: handlerSSL="{% if keystone_ssl | bool %}true{% else %}false{% endif %}"
deleted_lines: handlerSSL="{% if keystone_ssl_enabled | bool %}true{% else %}false{% endif %}"

commit_message:
Update .gitignore to exclude docs output

The running of `tox -e docs` generates some unwanted changes to be
staged.

The AUTHORS file was deleted since its written output from running
docs generation, so it should be ignored and not in the repo.

Change-Id: I58238fcf1834bf2b82481f42ce0540dcd09b1448

commit_message:
Switch Nova/Tempest to use/test Cinder API v2

As per https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/deprecate-v1-api
the Cinder API v1 was designated as deprecated in Juno and was meant
to be removed in Kilo, but appears to still be usable in Kilo.

This patch configures Nova to use the Cinder v2 API instead of the
v1 API.

This patch configures Tempest to test both the Cinder v1 and v2 API's
for now. Once the API is removed upstream we can change this.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1481542
Change-Id: I6513c07e1b5d5653b84ad0b2b490ac8451f2bdf1
(cherry picked from commit 16d1a5150411eee9a9dd41e624d8b4e39fdf681c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/81/220081/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: api_v2 = true

commit_message:
include cinder_all group vars file in cinder-* playbooks

If we don't explicitly set cinder as the service name, and then try and
install cinder onto a host that already has other services (such as
when you're installing cionder-volume ontobare metal where other
services exist), then the cinder plays get run with 'something else' as
the service name.  i.e., if installing ciner-volume onto a compute host
that has nova and neutron, then the cinder plays get run with neutron
as the service name.

This commit explicitly includes the cinder_all groups vars file, which
itself explicitly sets cinder as the service name.

Change-Id: Ibf0d68445400ce24513b067691b80e10af9806c4
Closes-Bug: #1491882
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/42/221242/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Handle unstarted instances

In the rare event that a VM is queried for CPU utilization before its
first boot, the entitled cycles may be 0.  This resulted in a divide by
zero error.  This change detects that scenario and removes the divide by
zero possibility.

Change-Id: If37422e7b501c60ad2b1cb610b8c7802e6543942
Closes-Bug: 1492831
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer-powervm refs/changes/43/220843/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If the entitled is zero, that generally means that the VM has not # been started yet (everything else would be zero as well). So to # avoid a divide by zero error, just return 0% in that case. if entitled == 0: return virt_inspector.CPUUtilStats(util=0.0)

commit_message:
python-neutronclient: Release version 3.0.0

We had a couple of requirements changes which require a minor version
bump, but more importantly, we had some backwards incompatible changes
which require a major version bump as well.

commit_message:
Correct some incorrect "optional" parameters

Some "optional" parameters are incorrect for
"create a load balancer VIP" call.
tenant_id should to be optional.
subnet_id (Optional) should not to be optional.
pool_id (Optional) should not to be optional.

So I Correct this three parameters in common.ent.
Closes-Bug: #1490820

Change-Id: I1bab5e2fc7869dfe6348ac455193595a8fee707e

commit_message:
Wait after restarting rabbitmq

This change Ie45446d3817b2f15631f03b2af84749fe936c67b generalized
the restart of the rabbitmq service.
However, on some platforms, the service may not be ready immediately
after the restart, in particular when based on systemd.
This commit introduces a call to the "rabbitmqctl wait" command.
Also cleanes up the code in restart_rpc_backend and performs the
restart only after rabbit_setuser fails.

Change-Id: I48bb54742d667f551e3c9413581dd677e832228b
Closes-bug: #1449056

commit_message:
Improve DB operations for quota reservation

This patch deals with the lock wait timeout and the deadlock errors
observed under high concurrency (api_workers >= 4) with the pymysql
driver. It includes the following changes:

- Stop setting dirty status for resource usage when creating
  reservation, as usage of reserved resources is not tracked anymore;
- Add a variable, increasing delay when retrying make_reservation
  upon a DBDeadlock error in order to reduce the chances of further
  collisions;
- Enable transaction retry upon DBDeadlock errors for set_quota_usage;
- Do not resync quota usage while making reservation. This puts a lot
  of stress on the database and is also wasteful since resource usage
  is very likely to change again once the transaction is committed;
- Use autonested_transaction to simplify logic around when the
  nested flag should be used.

Change-Id: I7a335f9ebea3c0d6fee6e6b757554e045a66075c
Closes-Bug: #1486134
Related-Blueprint: better-quotas

commit_message:
Conductor: Remove _update_stack_outputs from bay_conductor

In commit 6a264b6f, we involved template_def as a member of HeatPoller,
so this helper function _update_stack_outputs will be useless since
we don't need to call get_template_definition again.

Besides, adjuest the testcases.

Closes-Bug: #1493192
Change-Id: Ie2ff8bf6f7e29092b8b11f663b70fe1cc4e93814

Fix unit test errors caused by new mock version

This patch corrects a few errors that is currently breaking the gate
checks.  The trigger of these errors is an upgrade to Mock, but the
root is subtle issues with how Mock was being used.  All of these
changes will work correctly with the old and new versions of Mock.

1) Fix missing attribute errors (calls to non existing assert checks)
2) Fix use of assert_has_calls() (parameter should be a list)
3) Don't assume name of Mock instance
4) Upgrade to use of newer PBR to address import errors
       (this change will be forthcoming from an infra-bot)

Co-authored-by: Kaitlin Farr <kaitlin.farr@jhuapl.edu>
Closes-Bug: #1475909
Change-Id: Id4f46ae77bda5a89fb112a779c089542c3987e7b

commit_message:
Fix gate jobs after change to infra

No longer need the envdir setting in tox.ini.

Fix unit test errors caused by new mock version

This patch corrects a few errors that is currently breaking the gate
checks.  The trigger of these errors is an upgrade to Mock, but the
root is subtle issues with how Mock was being used.  All of these
changes will work correctly with the old and new versions of Mock.

1) Fix missing attribute errors (calls to non existing assert checks)
2) Fix use of assert_has_calls() (parameter should be a list)
3) Don't assume name of Mock instance
4) Upgrade to use of newer PBR to address import errors
       (this change will be forthcoming from an infra-bot)
5) Update versions based on CR 201162
6) Add python-subunit explicitly to test-requirements.txt
7) Remove extra pip install of tempest; use version from test-requirements

Co-authored-by: Kaitlin Farr <kaitlin.farr@jhuapl.edu>
Co-authored-by: Dave McCowan <dmccowan@cisco.com>
Closes-Bug: #1475909
Change-Id: Id4f46ae77bda5a89fb112a779c089542c3987e7b

commit_message:
Catch driver not found in API

Previously the server would return a 500 when creating
a datasource with an unknown driver.  The API code
failed to catch the error being thrown in that case,
resulting in a 500.

This change has the API catch the proper error, and
return the appropriate error code.

Change-Id: I52b2beb0c8ef08fc93b0d864d171592aa1f3c099
Closes-bug: 1491970

commit_message:
Improve error message in case no environment name

When created environment without name provided in request body, it
throw internal exception to user. So check whether name exist at
first, if not, return HTTPBadRequest with  more clear message to
user.

Change-Id: Ie0c0c9341b1084aae90ecfa7f7cf7b31e958902a
Closes-Bug: #1492703

commit_message:
Remove policy 'admin' rule support

Rule 'admin_api' was needed to keep backward compatibility with Juno,
since policy doesn't support it, we can delete it.

Change-Id: Ie5442711e2a4ed44438a5fe19c2c5d99e16715bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/66/221066/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: # NOTE(adam_g): We also check the previous 'admin' rule to ensure # compat with default juno policy.json. This double check may be # removed in Liberty. is_admin = (policy.enforce('admin_api', creds, creds) or policy.enforce('admin', creds, creds))

commit_message:
Change instructions to use get-pip

If you're going to install software using pip, then it means you're
willing to use pip to install software. If you are willing to do that,
then installing the latest pip via pip is completely reasonable. The
distro pip will often be too old or broken to work properly.

Closes-Bug: #1481085
Change-Id: If161c04aac30f489162cd72a329f71ddbe5635d6

subject: Initialise delete_object mock before it is called
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-08 09:39:36.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_shell.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient/commit/1841bd6010e91859a4fe97afa4da980b8daa1e03', 'message': 'Initialise delete_object mock before it is called

Attempt to fix the linked bug by initialising the mock instance for
Connection.delete_object before calling the SwiftService upload
method, so that the delete_object mock already exists before the
delete_segments jobs that run in multiple threads call it.  Otherwise
there is a risk that the delete_segment job threads could race while
creating either the delete_object mock or the
delete_object.return_value mock, resulting in each thread getting a
different instance. That would explain the intermittent test failures
reported in the bug.

Change-Id: Ia82697c093529076b0bbcc6bccd577afdf0839e1
Partial-Bug: #1480223
'}]
commit_message:
Initialise delete_object mock before it is called

Attempt to fix the linked bug by initialising the mock instance for
Connection.delete_object before calling the SwiftService upload
method, so that the delete_object mock already exists before the
delete_segments jobs that run in multiple threads call it.  Otherwise
there is a risk that the delete_segment job threads could race while
creating either the delete_object mock or the
delete_object.return_value mock, resulting in each thread getting a
different instance. That would explain the intermittent test failures
reported in the bug.

Change-Id: Ia82697c093529076b0bbcc6bccd577afdf0839e1
Partial-Bug: #1480223
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient refs/changes/19/221219/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # create the delete_object child mock here in attempt to fix # https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-swiftclient/+bug/1480223 connection.return_value.delete_object.return_value = None connection.return_value.put_object.return_value = EMPTY_ETAG # create the delete_object child mock here in attempt to fix # https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-swiftclient/+bug/1480223 connection.return_value.delete_object.return_value = None

commit_message:
Relax restrictions on server name

The server name is designed to be anything the user would like it to
be, so should be validated against name, not hostname. This is how
v2.0 worked, and v2.1 schema validation accidentally went over the top
here. v2.1 regressed at  f40b6a1d5c91628f78fdbc0417a3a394a69ab716

Change-Id: Ia32a452ab3a5d7cd5a5289e8e8bf9f8e5e404780
Partial-Bug: #1491511

commit_message:
Clean up requirements

We added some caps in I0b8de925276acff8ee71945b073c1df7a0d9d5b0 to
avoid a requirement trouble.
Currently a cap is controlled by upper-constraints.txt and the list
in requirements file don't match requirements in ofagent tree.
This change fixes it.

Change-Id: I82c4868d8cc8345014915fd3f8936634d4972203

commit_message:
Support for creation of subordinate CAs

Initial checkin of code to expose creation of subordinate CAs.
This checkin includes database changes, basic cert plugin changes,
API changes and tests.

Change-Id: Ic8f26a27dd5ed3b9f0d1797723fd5a8c9a0035e7
Implements: blueprint add-cas
Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio <jaosorior@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/11/219411/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def supports_create_ca(self): """Returns whether the plugin supports on-the-fly generation of subCAs :return: boolean, True if supported, defaults to False """ return False # pragma: no cover def create_ca(self, ca_create_dto): """Creates a subordinate CA upon request This call should onoy be made if a plugin returns True for supports_create_ca(). :param ca_create_dto: Data transfer object :class:`CACreateDTO` containing data required to generate a subordinate CA. This data includes the subject DN of the new CA signing certificate, a name for the new CA and a reference to the CA that will issue the new subordinate CA's signing certificate, :return: ca_info: Dictionary containing the data needed to create a models.CertificateAuthority object """ raise NotImplementedError # pragma: no cover class CACreateDTO(object): """Class that includes data needed to create a subordinate CA """ def __init__(self, name=None, subject_dn=None, parent_ca_id=None): """Creates a new CACreateDTO object. :param name: Name for the subordinate CA :param subject_dn: Subject DN for the new subordinate CA's signing certificate :param parent_ca_id: ID of the CA which is supposed to sign the subordinate CA's signing certificate. This is ID as known to the plugin (not the Barbican UUID) """ self.name = name self.subject_dn = subject_dn self.parent_ca_id = parent_ca_id

commit_message:
Renames sender to receiver

Receiver is an object that a method being invoked on.
In $foo.bar() $foo is a receiver.
However for unknown reason in was called sender

Change-Id: I4e7987a2af2173864ec2bed13bf0cb0d5f5e52c9

commit_message:
Implement deleted zone purging

Change-Id: I69e1be7e49dc4ee44f1f2b454ae5c758f4389245
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/59/207959/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import datetime def _create_deleted_zone(self, name, mock_deletion_time): domain = self.create_domain( name=name, deleted_at=mock_deletion_time, ) domain.action = 'NONE' domain.status = 'DELETED' domain.deleted_at = mock_deletion_time domain = self.storage.update_domain(self.admin_context, domain) return domain @mock.patch.object(notifier.Notifier, "info") def test_purge_zones_nothing_to_purge(self, mock_notifier): # Create a zone self.create_domain() mock_notifier.reset_mock() now = datetime.datetime(2015, 7, 31, 0, 0) self.central_service.purge_deleted_zones( self.admin_context, limit=100, time_threshold=now, ) n_zones = self.central_service.count_domains(self.admin_context) self.assertEqual(n_zones, 1) @mock.patch.object(notifier.Notifier, "info") def test_purge_zones_one_to_purge(self, mock_notifier): new = datetime.datetime(2015, 7, 30, 0, 0) now = datetime.datetime(2015, 7, 31, 0, 0) self._create_deleted_zone('example.org.', new) mock_notifier.reset_mock() self.central_service.purge_deleted_zones( self.admin_context, limit=100, time_threshold=now, ) n_zones = self.central_service.count_domains(self.admin_context) self.assertEqual(n_zones, 0) @mock.patch.object(notifier.Notifier, "info") def test_purge_zones_one_to_purge_out_of_two(self, mock_notifier): old = datetime.datetime(2015, 7, 20, 0, 0) time_threshold = datetime.datetime(2015, 7, 25, 0, 0) new = datetime.datetime(2015, 7, 30, 0, 0) self._create_deleted_zone('old.org.', old) self._create_deleted_zone('new.org.', new) mock_notifier.reset_mock() self.central_service.purge_deleted_zones( self.admin_context, limit=100, time_threshold=time_threshold, ) n_zones = self.central_service.count_domains(self.admin_context) self.assertEqual(n_zones, 1) @mock.patch.object(notifier.Notifier, "info") def test_purge_zones_with_orphans(self, mock_notifier): old = datetime.datetime(2015, 7, 20, 0, 0) time_threshold = datetime.datetime(2015, 7, 25, 0, 0) zone = self._create_deleted_zone('example.org.', old) s = self.create_domain(name='subdomain.example.org.') self.assertEqual(s['parent_domain_id'], zone['id']) s = self.create_domain(name='subdomain2.example.org.') self.assertEqual(s['parent_domain_id'], zone['id']) mock_notifier.reset_mock() self.central_service.purge_deleted_zones( self.admin_context, limit=100, time_threshold=time_threshold, ) n_zones = self.central_service.count_domains(self.admin_context) self.assertEqual(n_zones, 2) for z in self.central_service.find_domains(self.admin_context): self.assertEqual(z.parent_domain_id, None) side_effect=fail_once_then_pass):

commit_message:
Implement socket timeout in v1

Add endpoint_override keyword to v2.Client() and check for the
session argument in DesignateAdapter()
Add unit test, fix minor typos

Change-Id: I038ec7b0d1feadc9642bd47285e397b3fe84c13c
Closes-Bug: 1469739

commit_message:
Add galera_address to all playbooks installing galera_client

This patch includes the galera_address var for each playbook
that deploys a role depending on galera_client and thereby
dropping a .my.cnf onto the target.

Prior to this patch the .my.cnf would be dropped with the
galera_client's role default of 127.0.0.1 as the host address.

The address of 127.0.0.1 is intentionally left to deploy on
the galera servers so that the .my.cnf will be configured to
interact with the local database.

Change-Id: Ife33c68d825ecf1e6cdb6784802e9a099eb54289
Closes-Bug: #1487353

added_lines: galera_address: "{{ internal_lb_vip_address }}"

commit_message:
Mistral docs: writing workflow

Implements blueprint: mistral-docs-writing-workflow

Change-Id: I6c0d3ff6cc732227dd4840cc3d09102bb3622851
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/28/221028/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This article is a tutorial of writing workflow for Mistral step by step. 1. Create text file with *.yaml* extension and open text editor. 2. First of all, write *YAML* marker and version:: --- # YAML marker. version: '2.0' # Mistral DSL version. 3. Type the name of workflow:: ... create_nova_server: 4. Write the type of the workflow:: ... create_nova_server: type: direct 5. If needed, provide a description of the workflow:: ... create_nova_server: ... description: Creates VM and waits till VM is ACTIVE. 6. If needed, specify input section for the workflow:: ... create_nova_server: ... input: - name - image_id - flavor_id 7. Then, write keyword *tasks*:: ... create_nova_server: ... tasks: 8. Declare tasks. One of the easiest way is to specify task names and transitions first:: ... tasks: create_vm: description: Initial request to create a VM. on-success: - wait_vm_active wait_vm_active: description: Waits till VM is ACTIVE. 9. After that go deeper and provide additional task properties:: ... tasks: create_vm: description: Initial request to create a VM. action: nova.servers_create name=<% $.name %> image=<% $.image_id %> flavor=<% $.flavor_id %> publish: vm_id: <% $.create_vm.id %> on-success: - wait_vm_active wait_vm_active: description: Waits till VM is ACTIVE. action: nova.servers_find id=<% $.vm_id %> status="ACTIVE" retry: count: 10 delay: 10 publish: status: <% $.wait_vm_active.status %>

commit_message:
Set max on max_password_length to passlib max

With this patch if someone overrides the PASSLIB_MAX_PASSWORD_SIZE
environment variable, keystone will fail to start with a config
error instead of a passlib.exc.PasswordSizeError when creating
a user.

Change-Id: Ic59a7964d8044ba3ab7cb6539fecca1d190dbbcc
Closes-Bug: #1175905

commit_message:
Pull instack into upstream tripleo

Upstream triple are switching over use a different set of tools to
manage a tripleo cloud. These tools will eventually replace some of
the current tripleo repositories (e.g. tripleo-incubator)

Change-Id: I2cbfa5a00f8c5679ab422e89da143eef1fe3f8c1

commit_message:
Add a functional test to validate dvr snat namespace

Add a functional test to validate the dvr snat
namespace and its internal interfaces when internal
networks are removed and added.

Change-Id: Id44f5e5899e959be53b09e6f9bc732f553ae9a5a
Related-Bug: #1479130
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/02/216902/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _assert_snat_namespace_exists(self, router): namespace = dvr_snat_ns.SnatNamespace.get_snat_ns_name( router.router_id) self.assertTrue(self._namespace_exists(namespace)) def _get_dvr_snat_namespace_device_status( self, router, internal_dev_name=None): """Function returns the internal and external device status.""" snat_ns = dvr_snat_ns.SnatNamespace.get_snat_ns_name( router.router_id) external_port = router.get_ex_gw_port() external_device_name = router.get_external_device_name( external_port['id']) qg_device_created_successfully = ip_lib.device_exists( external_device_name, namespace=snat_ns) sg_device_created_successfully = ip_lib.device_exists( internal_dev_name, namespace=snat_ns) return qg_device_created_successfully, sg_device_created_successfully def test_dvr_router_snat_namespace_with_interface_remove(self): """Test to validate the snat namespace with interface remove. This test validates the snat namespace for all the external and internal devices. It also validates if the internal device corresponding to the router interface is removed when the router interface is deleted. """ self.agent.conf.agent_mode = 'dvr_snat' router_info = self.generate_dvr_router_info() snat_internal_port = router_info[l3_constants.SNAT_ROUTER_INTF_KEY] router1 = self.manage_router(self.agent, router_info) csnat_internal_port = ( router1.router[l3_constants.SNAT_ROUTER_INTF_KEY]) # Now save the internal device name to verify later internal_device_name = router1.get_snat_int_device_name( csnat_internal_port[0]['id']) self._assert_snat_namespace_exists(router1) qg_device, sg_device = self._get_dvr_snat_namespace_device_status( router1, internal_dev_name=internal_device_name) self.assertTrue(qg_device) self.assertTrue(sg_device) self.assertEqual(router1.snat_ports, snat_internal_port) # Now let us not pass INTERFACE_KEY, to emulate # the interface has been removed. router1.router[l3_constants.INTERFACE_KEY] = [] # Now let us not pass the SNAT_ROUTER_INTF_KEY, to emulate # that the server did not send it, since the interface has been # removed. router1.router[l3_constants.SNAT_ROUTER_INTF_KEY] = [] self.agent._process_updated_router(router1.router) router_updated = self.agent.router_info[router_info['id']] self._assert_snat_namespace_exists(router_updated) qg_device, sg_device = self._get_dvr_snat_namespace_device_status( router_updated, internal_dev_name=internal_device_name) self.assertFalse(sg_device) self.assertTrue(qg_device)

subject: Fix Request ID has a double 'req-' at the start
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-19 13:46:24.000000000', 'files': ['glance/api/middleware/context.py', 'glance/tests/unit/test_context_middleware.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/0b27935058e359278a019683c63e0a8586564b1b', 'message': "Fix Request ID has a double 'req-' at the start

Check if request-id starts with 'req-' in context middleware,
if not then add prefix 'req-' to request-id.

Change-Id: I4fae1f6274b5d89fd3bdd1aefd4abc2129afd8ef
Closes-Bug: #1478690
(cherry picked from commit 5085aff80fafbb77a590cc8c1a6d60f5f60143e2)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Request ID has a double 'req-' at the start

Check if request-id starts with 'req-' in context middleware,
if not then add prefix 'req-' to request-id.

Change-Id: I4fae1f6274b5d89fd3bdd1aefd4abc2129afd8ef
Closes-Bug: #1478690
(cherry picked from commit 5085aff80fafbb77a590cc8c1a6d60f5f60143e2)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/17/214617/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_response(self): req = self._build_request() req.context = glance.context.RequestContext() request_id = req.context.request_id resp = webob.Response() resp.request = req self._build_middleware().process_response(resp) self.assertEqual(request_id, resp.headers['x-openstack-request-id']) resp_req_id = resp.headers['x-openstack-request-id'] # Validate that request-id do not starts with 'req-req-' self.assertFalse(resp_req_id.startswith(b'req-req-')) self.assertTrue(resp_req_id.startswith(b'req-')) self.assertEqual(request_id, resp.headers['x-openstack-request-id']) resp_req_id = resp.headers['x-openstack-request-id'] # Validate that request-id do not starts with 'req-req-' self.assertFalse(resp_req_id.startswith(b'req-req-')) self.assertTrue(resp_req_id.startswith(b'req-'))

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary pylockfile jobs

devstack does not install pylockfile at all as no one is
using it. we should shut off all the test jobs.

commit_message:
Fix typo in magnum/common/x509/config.py

There are some typo in magnum/common/x509/config.py.
This patch fixes below.

* ALLOWD_EXTENSIONS => ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS
* DEFAULR_ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS => DEFAULT_ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS
* DEFAULR_ALLOWED_KEY_USAGE => DEFAULT_ALLOWED_KEY_USAGE

Change-Id: Iedd7ff73e5ae61b73660c91dd4772ad8a92b52d7
Closes-Bug: #1492540
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/52/221252/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS = ['"%s"' % e.value for e in extensions.Extensions] DEFAULT_ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS = [DEFAULT_ALLOWED_KEY_USAGE = [ default=DEFAULT_ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS, '%s') % ', '.join(ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS)), default=DEFAULT_ALLOWED_KEY_USAGE,
deleted_lines: ALLOWD_EXTENSIONS = ['"%s"' % e.value for e in extensions.Extensions] DEFAULR_ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS = [DEFAULR_ALLOWED_KEY_USAGE = [ default=DEFAULR_ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS, '%s') % ', '.join(ALLOWD_EXTENSIONS)), default=DEFAULR_ALLOWED_KEY_USAGE,

commit_message:
Use devstack functions for registering Manila

Use devstack functions for registration of Manila to avoid
incompatibilities in service registering approach. Also, we should
reuse already defined functions that minimizes our code removing
duplication.

Change-Id: Id6e56426b212435366a36122dbeddc52910d9828
Closes-Bug: #1492133

commit_message:
Added occurrences of requirements validation

Added validation check for occurrences property value of requirements.
Included unit testcases

Change-Id: I6e4fc6769464a3973db5b778d0d318ab7525510e
Partially Implements: blueprint tosca-requirement-changes
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tosca-parser refs/changes/17/219217/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from toscaparser.common.exception import InvalidPropertyValueErrorfrom toscaparser.dataentity import DataEntity self._validate_requirements_properties(value) def _validate_requirements_properties(self, requirements): # TODO(anyone): Only occurences property of the requirements is # validated here. Validation of other requirement properties are being # validated in different files. Better to keep all the requirements # properties validation here. for key, value in requirements.items(): if key == 'occurrences': self._validate_occurrences(value) break def _validate_occurrences(self, occurrences): DataEntity.validate_datatype('list', occurrences) for value in occurrences: DataEntity.validate_datatype('integer', value) if len(occurrences) != 2 or not (0 <= occurrences[0] <= occurrences[1]) \ or occurrences[1] == 0: raise InvalidPropertyValueError(what=(occurrences))

subject: Manage cleanup of .ctl/.pid files for LibreSwan
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-13 17:34:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/ff6c01773938a31c1d679fc6918e5e8199e9b5e4', 'message': "WIP: Cleanup .ctl/.pid files for LibreSwan

LibreSwan checks for the presence of pid/ctl files when starting up and
will error out if they already exist. However, LibreSwan's usage of the
capabilities library removes the access required to cleanup .ctl and
.pid files on shutdown. This is not considered a bug by the
maintainers, so the LibreSwan driver must work around it by checking if
it is okay to remove the files and removing them before restarting.

(WIP: adding tests.)

Change-Id: I5c215d70c348524979b740f882029f74e400e6d7
Closes-Bug: #1331502
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-18 13:03:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/ed340a13d4f7263e471b62de012b5d37455b0e02', 'message': "WIP: Cleanup .ctl/.pid files for LibreSwan

LibreSwan checks for the presence of pid/ctl files when starting up and
will error out if they already exist. However, LibreSwan's usage of the
capabilities library removes the access required to cleanup .ctl and
.pid files on shutdown. This is not considered a bug by the
maintainers, so the LibreSwan driver must work around it by checking if
it is okay to remove the files and removing them before restarting.

(WIP: adding tests.)

Change-Id: I5c215d70c348524979b740f882029f74e400e6d7
Closes-Bug: #1331502
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-18 15:10:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/0b20ab4197e50037c8c4117afff3628c1fcb3197', 'message': "Cleanup .ctl/.pid files for LibreSwan

LibreSwan checks for the presence of pid/ctl files when starting up and
will error out if they already exist. However, LibreSwan's usage of the
capabilities library removes the access required to cleanup .ctl and
.pid files on shutdown. This is not considered a bug by the LibreSwan
maintainers, so the LibreSwan driver must work around it by checking if
it is okay to remove the files and removing them before restarting.

Change-Id: I5c215d70c348524979b740f882029f74e400e6d7
Closes-Bug: #1331502
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2015-08-19 14:12:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/9d77d9a052e421fc09118291ab4d5b2a8bd9f3bf', 'message': "Manage cleanup of .ctl/.pid files for LibreSwan

LibreSwan checks for the presence of pid/ctl files when starting up and
will error out if they already exist. However, LibreSwan's usage of the
capabilities library removes the access required to cleanup .ctl and
.pid files on shutdown if any of the directories in the path are missing
explicit permissions for root. This is not considered a bug by the
LibreSwan maintainers, so the LibreSwan driver must work around it by
checking if it is okay to remove the files and removing them on
startup. It must also wait for shutdown to complete before restarting
the daemon on LibreSwanProcess.restart().

Introduces new configuration for retrying check for process shutdown.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I5c215d70c348524979b740f882029f74e400e6d7
Closes-Bug: #1331502
"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2015-08-19 14:54:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/800bd3f5a98b8b419b816a0abf1fbb8fa04eac89', 'message': "Manage cleanup of .ctl/.pid files for LibreSwan

commit_message:
Manage cleanup of .ctl/.pid files for LibreSwan

LibreSwan checks for the presence of pid/ctl files when starting up and
will error out if they already exist. However, LibreSwan's usage of the
capabilities library removes the access required to cleanup .ctl and
.pid files on shutdown if any of the directories in the path are missing
explicit permissions for root. This is not considered a bug by the
LibreSwan maintainers, so the LibreSwan driver must work around it by
checking if it is okay to remove the files and removing them on
startup. It must also wait for shutdown to complete before restarting
the daemon on LibreSwanProcess.restart().

Introduces new configuration for retrying check for process shutdown.

DocImpact


Change-Id: I5c215d70c348524979b740f882029f74e400e6d7
Closes-Bug: #1331502
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas refs/changes/73/212673/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import os import os.path from neutron.i18n import _LE from oslo_log import log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def _needs_control_file_cleanup(self, pid_file): """Check if it is okay to cleanup process control files""" if not os.path.exists(pid_file): return False try: # If the pid file exists, delve into the process information # and verify that it doesn't match the environment (this # *seems* like it should be pretty unlikely). We really don't # need to worry about the pid belonging to some other process # because we aren't going to touch the process, we just want to # make sure that "force cleaning" these files is okay. with open(pid_file, 'r') as f: pid = f.readline().strip() with open('/proc/%s/cmdline' % pid) as cmd_line_file: cmd_line = cmd_line_file.readline() if self.pid_path in cmd_line and 'pluto' in cmd_line: # Okay the process is probably a libreswan process # and it contains the pid_path in the command # line... could be a race. Log to error and return # that it is *NOT* okay to clean up files. We are # logging to error instead of debug because it # indicates something bad has happened and this is # valuable information for figuring it out. LOG.error(_LE('Process %(pid)s exists with command ' 'line %(cmd_line)s.') % {'pid': pid, 'cmd_line' : cmd_line}) return False except IOError: LOG.exception(_LE('Unable to check control files on startup')) # If we cannot check the files, we can assume that we aren't # running and attempt a cleanup. return True def start(self): # LibreSwan's use of the capablities library may prevent the ctl # and pid files from being cleaned up. Cleaning up on stop because # of potential race conditions, so it is marginally safter to try a # workaround on startup. pid_file = '%s.pid' % self.pid_path if self._needs_control_file_cleanup(pid_file): try: LOG.debug('Removing %(pidfile)s and %(ctlfile)s', {'pidfile': pid_file, 'ctlfile': '%s.ctl' % self.pid_path }) os.remove(pid_file) os.remove('%s.ctl' % self.pid_path) except OSError: LOG.exception(_LE('Unable to remove libreswan control ' 'files'), self.id) raise # The final check is whether LibreSwan can start pluto at all. # We'll let it take care of that. super(LibreSwanProcess, self).start()

commit_message:
Use 'read_file_as_root' func in service_instance

In 'service_instance' module used utils.execute function for getting value
of public key. Reuse already existing func 'read_file_as_root' for getting
value of public key file.

Change-Id: I7047bba17df1f12907a4c7ced2c17afc7e05756c
Closes-Bug: #1483655

commit_message:
Remove cherry-pick fo rdomanager patch

We no longer need this as the heat-admin user has been
restored. Also use the heat-admin user to retrieve logs.

Change-Id: I0555873afbb87f8fe116161a6b7a74e12187052e
Depends-On: I2235b9690c01542d8a28ec1c1a4607de751aea29

commit_message:
Add NodeAdminUserData interface for "heat-admin" user

Reinstates the heat-admin user via template user-data, which
replaces the previous boothook injected user provided by the
(deprecated now removed) heat instance_user option.

This has some advantages over the heat.conf option, e.g it allows
for much easier customzation of the user configuration (additional
SSH keys, adding groups etc), and also in future if we support
deploying more than one overcloud you could specify a different
user per deployment.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2235b9690c01542d8a28ec1c1a4607de751aea29
Closes-Bug: #1229849
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/57/220057/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: user_data: {get_resource: UserData} # Combine the NodeAdminUserData and NodeUserData mime archives UserData: type: OS::Heat::MultipartMime properties: parts: - config: {get_resource: NodeAdminUserData} type: multipart - config: {get_resource: NodeUserData} type: multipart # Creates the "heat-admin" user if configured via the environment # Should return a OS::Heat::MultipartMime reference via OS::stack_id NodeAdminUserData: type: OS::TripleO::NodeAdminUserData # For optional operator additional userdata # Should return a OS::Heat::MultipartMime reference via OS::stack_id

commit_message:
Remove the test cases for handle_errors to fix the py27 gate issue

As we just change the exceptions handle method in horizon, now the
test cases have some issues, so disable them first to fix all py27
gate fails.

Change-Id: Ic369434a40ff209b06de9481884637d46ee588f7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral-dashboard refs/changes/75/221275/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

In exception.handle the user_message was being overridden so
failed to include the exception message even if %(exc)s was in

Change-Id: I2bcc041a2f8a3b929c1acbbf3d3ff1e76b5646e9
Closes-Bug: #1493025

commit_message:
Ensure exc message is included in user_message

In exception.handle the user_message was being overridden so
failed to include the exception message even if %(exc)s was in
the message. This patch ensures the correct user_message is
produced by exception.handle()

Change-Id: I2bcc041a2f8a3b929c1acbbf3d3ff1e76b5646e9
Closes-Bug: #1493025
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/00/221000/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We trust messages from our own exceptions if issubclass(exc_type, HorizonException): user_message = log_entry elif message: ret = handler(request, user_message, redirect, ignore,
deleted_lines: # We trust messages from our own exceptions if issubclass(exc_type, HorizonException): user_message = exc_value if message: ret = handler(request, message, redirect, ignore,

commit_message:
integration: Add debugging information

In case of debugging a failure having the last stack errors
the nova instances list and the alarm list help.

This change adds them.

Change-Id: Ic3f51533341f4fe2b44c5b6dbe0538ef3a53cc91
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/49/219149/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ $EXIT_CODE -ne 0 ] ; then heat stack-show integration_test nova list ceilometer alarm-list fi

subject: Rely on autorequire for config resource ordering
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-12 10:40:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron/commit/73094f04477614e3ae35f082586d33e012e89c60', 'message': 'Rely on autorequire for config resource ordering

Currently we specify the ordering of config resources wherever it is
necessary based on the presence of the file it will write to, or the
presence of the package in charge of providing the file it will write
to.

Those kind of ordering can be specified directly at the resource level
using the autorequire mechanism. With this patch, any config resource
will make sure the package in charge of providing the file will be
installed first.

Change-Id: I5542165142516fcd8fd3969c24ca92ac221452bd

commit_message:
Rely on autorequire for config resource ordering

Currently we specify the ordering of config resources wherever it is
necessary based on the presence of the file it will write to, or the
presence of the package in charge of providing the file it will write
to.

Those kind of ordering can be specified directly at the resource level
using the autorequire mechanism. With this patch, any config resource
will make sure the package in charge of providing the file will be
installed first.

Change-Id: I5542165142516fcd8fd3969c24ca92ac221452bd

commit_message:
Add rados_connect_timeout parameter in glance config

 It adds rados_connect_timeout parameter with default value
to glance config, which tells how much time glance-api has
to wait before close the connection.

Setting 'rados_connect_timeout' <= 0  means no timeout.

A CR that adds "rados_connect_timeout": #200554
change-id: Ib44f74063d5a8332c6b5f3e15bcfa044c86bef9b

Change-Id: I2352bdec2a3339785eb38249afe385c5e496457c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/37/218837/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*rados_connect_timeout*] # Optinal. Timeout value (in seconds) used when connecting # to ceph cluster. If value <= 0, no timeout is set and # default librados value is used. # $rados_connect_timeout = '0' 'glance_store/default_store': value => 'rbd'; 'glance_store/rbd_store_ceph_conf': value => $rbd_store_ceph_conf; 'glance_store/rbd_store_user': value => $rbd_store_user; 'glance_store/rbd_store_pool': value => $rbd_store_pool; 'glance_store/rbd_store_chunk_size': value => $rbd_store_chunk_size; 'glance_store/rados_connect_timeout': value => $rados_connect_timeout;

commit_message:
Allow deployment when DVR is enabled and L2 pop and tunneling are disabled

Deployment with enabled Neutron DVR and disabled L2 population should be
allowed in case of VLAN segmentation for private networks.
Since this patch has been merged (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/166707/)
such combination is allowed in Neutron.

Change-Id: Ideb2dd0dcef4e478ed4aa5a151c30e6e2cb5332e
Closes-bug: #1475283
(cherry picked from commit f60061a2a80956b6a80f68fbdaef04b6662e0f4d)

commit_message:
Remap Admin network when PXE interface is changed

1. Check whether PXE interface was changed and remap Admin-pxe network accordingly.
2. Fix _get_pxe_iface_name to check all meta info related to PXE interface.
3. Update node's IP and MAC before checking it against interfaces meta.
4. Fix 'pxe' flag assignment in tests.

Change-Id: I6bec445dbc56c9caad12926a2733c59e82e58e36
Partial-bug: #1466148

commit_message:
_bind_devices query only existing ports

If a port is deleted right before _bind_devices is called,
get_ports_attributes will throw an exception since the row
corresponding to the port doesn't exist in the OVS DB.
Avoid that setting if_exists to True. The port will be
processed as deleted by the agent in the following iteration.

Change-Id: Ia6590d76f8683e6cba562cde3c39b051549f6c04
Closes-bug: #1489014

commit_message:
Use min and max on IntOpt option types

Latest version of oslo.config support the ability to set valid
range on IntOpt option values.  This path makes use of that feature
for a number of options with well known minimum and maximum values.

Change-Id: Ifec4afcc5673563e1e63fe131b9df753818f0f98

commit_message:
Add Security group rule create/delete to plugin

Add security group create/delete functionality to plugin
and to NB DB.

Change-Id: I3b666659ca6a068a23e18202b95ae3853acd950c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/03/220803/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def add_security_group_rules(self, sg_name, new_rules): secgroup_json = self.driver.get_key('secgroup', sg_name) secgroup = jsonutils.loads(secgroup_json) rules = secgroup.get('rules', []) rules.extend(new_rules) secgroup['rules'] = rules secgroup_json = jsonutils.dumps(secgroup) self.driver.set_key('secgroup', sg_name, secgroup_json) def delete_security_group_rule(self, sg_name, sgr_id): secgroup_json = self.driver.get_key('secgroup', sg_name) secgroup = jsonutils.loads(secgroup_json) rules = secgroup.get('rules') new_rules = [] for rule in rules: if rule['id'] != sgr_id: new_rules.append(rule) secgroup['rules'] = new_rules secgroup_json = jsonutils.dumps(secgroup) self.driver.set_key('secgroup', sg_name, secgroup_json)

commit_message:
Security group create/delete to DF plugin

Add security group create/delete implementation in the plugin
and write entries in the NB DB.
Comment out centralized DF tests

Change-Id: I96f1758399914b90a287896efb0c14ff92359fe0

added_lines: def create_security_group(self, name, **columns): secgroup = {} secgroup['name'] = name for col, val in columns.items(): secgroup[col] = val secgroup_json = jsonutils.dumps(secgroup) self.driver.create_key('secgroup', name, secgroup_json) def delete_security_group(self, name): self.driver.delete_key('secgroup', name)

commit_message:
Add functional test for access control (DELETE) with Keystone

This patch adds the following cases:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/383469/

These cases are created using Orthogonal array testing technique with
the following procedure in order to gurantee the coverage.
* dump all parameters and thier values for the access control test
  http://paste.openstack.org/show/405142/
* create cases, combinations above parameters and values, then map to
  the test schema for functional test
  http://paste.openstack.org/show/405130/
* summarize the cases
  Table A * Table B * (No.1 to No.4 in Table C) +
  Table A * (No.1 in Table B) * (No.6, No.11-12, No.15-16, No.21,
  No.26-27, No.30 in Table C)
* split to several scenarios from the summarized cases using http method
  such as PUT, GET and so on for easier review

user information: http://paste.openstack.org/show/405097/

Change-Id: I6983e71b403f94caf8de885ce56537f17798fab1

  of workflow.
* Specification validation logic is now explicitly split into two methods:
  validate_schema() and validate_semantics() where the second one is supposed
  to implement integrity checks and other more high-level rules that are
  impossible to define in JSON schema.

Change-Id: I60937b77e39133e3b254fed574e6aec6aa402eb0

commit_message:
Raising exception if there aren't start tasks in direct workflow

* Now if direct workflow graph doesn't have start tasks (ones with no
  inbound transitions) then an exception gets raised.
* Refactoring workflow specifications: moving specification related method
  from direct workflow controller into workflow specification.
* Implemented the mechanism of polymorphic DSL entities. At this point
  there's a hierarchy of specification classes to represent different types
  of workflow.
* Specification validation logic is now explicitly split into two methods:
  validate_schema() and validate_semantics() where the second one is supposed
  to implement integrity checks and other more high-level rules that are
  impossible to define in JSON schema.
* Other minor refactoring and style changes.

Change-Id: I60937b77e39133e3b254fed574e6aec6aa402eb0

commit_message:
Change install docs to fix wrong command

I fixed sample command for changing permission of directory which is exposed
to docker container.

Current docs command us to change permissions of "rally_db" directory.
But this directory is never created and used to being exposed.

So I changed it from "rally_db" to "/var/lib/rally_container" which
is exposed to container.

Change-Id: I61ffb4ce2c5546678bb97e2052bb196811b3e0bf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/83/221083/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo chown 65500 /var/lib/rally_container

commit_message:
Remove context from dispatcher and scheduler

We don't need context in scheduler layer. This patch removed context
usage in dispatcher and scheduler module.

Change-Id: I6b6f4bdc1419d1c934ee1fb06bcface55d85ac6a

commit_message:
Fixes file cache TypeError

The internal cache (common.filecache) uses dogpile.cache's dbm backend,
which uses the bsddb package from the standardlib (in py2 only). bsddb
however breaks with a TypeError if the cache key is a unicode string.

This change fixes this by using the ``key_mangler`` arg on cache
creation, which (according to the dogpile.cache docs) is to be used with
dbm/bsddb.

Change-Id: Ie4911e31567d773357da99af3ded0548ad0b7db1
Closes-Bug: #1492205
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/75/220475/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Reflect provider change in puppet-openstacklib
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-06 11:43:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance/commit/0ebb9ee77e9afb453bece77f12eedb23d6b2d188', 'message': "Reflect provider change in puppet-openstacklib

With the creation of the new openstack_config provider, some processing
that was done in glance_api_config has been centralized in
openstack_config.

The same changes apply for glance_registry_config and
glance_cache_config

Impacted methods are :

  * section
  * setting
  * separator

Also, this commit adds the fact that, when passing a specific string
(ensure_absent_val) the provider will behave as if ensure => absent was
specified. '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' is the default value for
ensure_absent_val.

The use case is the following :

glance_api_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => 'bar' } # will work as usual

glance_api_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' } # will mean absent

That means that all the current :

if $myvar {
  glance_api_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }
} else {
  glance_api_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : ensure => absent }
}

can be removed in favor of :

glance_api_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }

If for any reason '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' turns out to be a valid value for
a specific parameter. One could by pass that doing the following :

glance_api_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>',
ensure_absent_val => 'foo' }

Change-Id: I3bbdf63d1b9b5a2daba30fd4ba897db703f979ae

commit_message:
Reflect provider change in puppet-openstacklib

With the creation of the new openstack_config provider, some processing
that was done in glance_api_config has been centralized in
openstack_config.

The same changes apply for glance_registry_config and
glance_cache_config

Impacted methods are :

  * section
  * setting
  * separator

Also, this commit adds the fact that, when passing a specific string
(ensure_absent_val) the provider will behave as if ensure => absent was
specified. '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' is the default value for
ensure_absent_val.

The use case is the following :

glance_api_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => 'bar' } # will work as usual

glance_api_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' } # will mean absent

That means that all the current :

if $myvar {
  glance_api_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }
} else {
  glance_api_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : ensure => absent }
}

can be removed in favor of :

glance_api_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }

If for any reason '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' turns out to be a valid value for
a specific parameter. One could by pass that doing the following :

glance_api_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>',
ensure_absent_val => 'foo' }

Change-Id: I3bbdf63d1b9b5a2daba30fd4ba897db703f979ae
Depends-On: I0eeebde3aac2662cc7e69bfad7f8d2481463a218
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/94/209894/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ### Types #### glance_api_config The `glance_api_config` provider is a children of the ini_setting provider. It allows one to write an entry in the `/etc/glance/glance-api.conf` file. ```puppet glance_api_config { 'DEFAULT/verbose' : value => true, } ``` This will write `verbose=true` in the `[DEFAULT]` section. ##### name Section/setting name to manage from `glance-api.conf` ##### value The value of the setting to be defined. ##### secret Whether to hide the value from Puppet logs. Defaults to `false`. ##### ensure_absent_val If value is equal to ensure_absent_val then the resource will behave as if `ensure => absent` was specified. Defaults to `<SERVICE DEFAULT>` #### glance_registry_config The `glance_registry_config` provider is a children of the ini_setting provider. It allows one to write an entry in the `/etc/glance/glance-registry.conf` file. ```puppet glance_registry_config { 'DEFAULT/verbose' : value => true, } ``` This will write `verbose=true` in the `[DEFAULT]` section. ##### name Section/setting name to manage from `glance-registry.conf` ##### value The value of the setting to be defined. ##### secret Whether to hide the value from Puppet logs. Defaults to `false`. ##### ensure_absent_val If value is equal to ensure_absent_val then the resource will behave as if `ensure => absent` was specified. Defaults to `<SERVICE DEFAULT>` #### glance_cache_config The `glance_cache_config` provider is a children of the ini_setting provider. It allows one to write an entry in the `/etc/glance/glance-cache.conf` file. ```puppet glance_cache_config { 'DEFAULT/verbose' : value => true, } ``` This will write `verbose=true` in the `[DEFAULT]` section. ##### name Section/setting name to manage from `glance-cache.conf` ##### value The value of the setting to be defined. ##### secret Whether to hide the value from Puppet logs. Defaults to `false`. ##### ensure_absent_val If value is equal to ensure_absent_val then the resource will behave as if `ensure => absent` was specified. Defaults to `<SERVICE DEFAULT>`

commit_message:
Update master for liberty-3 testing

This patch updates the OpenStack service SHA's to the Liberty-3
milestone in order to finalise testing and configuration
adjustments before the release of Liberty.

Change-Id: I30291da03c8293518fe81be121079fc52af55020

commit_message:
Set client versions deployed to use global requirements

This patch removes all SHA specifications for the OpenStack clients
so that any client requirement versions are determined solely from
the requirements of the OpenStack service and Global requirements
files.

This resolves issues where the client versions we carry are
incompatible with the services, resulting in unexpected failures.

The Tempest SHA configuration is moved into openstack_other so that
it can be addressed seperately when updating the SHA's. This will
be useful when master is branched to become liberty and all the
OpenStack services start to track an upstream stable/liberty branch.

The Global Requirements SHA configuration is shifted to
openstack_services for a similar reason. It will track an upstream
stable/liberty branch with all the openstack services.

Change-Id: I8f90389d22d2581814c4c62cfd37d0a4405bfd30

commit_message:
Rely on autorequire for config resource ordering

Currently we specify the ordering of config resources wherever it is
necessary based on the presence of the file it will write to, or the
presence of the package in charge of providing the file it will write
to.

Those kind of ordering can be specified directly at the resource level
using the autorequire mechanism. With this patch, any config resource
will make sure the package in charge of providing the file will be
installed first.

Change-Id: Idb19da25958e79787b0c66e4ae275216849a9a2e
